definition: to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude

sentences.english: I was also facing life newly widowed.
sentences.chinese: 并且，我还开始面对丧夫寡居的生活。

sentences.english: But the dominant figure is the widow and grandmother, Maryam.
sentences.chinese: 但核心人物是寡居的祖母马里亚姆。

sentences.english: Women can be priests, if they are old and widowed.
sentences.chinese: 女子若是年老寡居的，也能当祭司。

sentences.english: Widows would sell the shirts and make a little money.
sentences.chinese: 那些寡居的妇女们可以通过卖这些服装赚一些钱。

sentences.english: Across the way their widowed first cousin lived in a yellow house.
sentences.chinese: 住在她们对面的黄色房子里的是她们寡居的嫡亲堂妹。

definition: to live as widow/to observe widowhood
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
faithful (to the memory of betrothed)/constant (of widow who remains unmarried)
